alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Taylor; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 2:33AM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow continues north of I-90 for the rest of tonight with a second round of heavy snow, sleet, and freezing rain starting area-wide by mid-morning... .Snow persists north of Interstate 90 from southeast Minnesota into west-central Wisconsin for the remainder of the night and into the morning hours. Additional snow amounts should be around 1 to 3 inches and confined closer to the Interstate 94 corridor. The second and stronger wave of snow arrives from south to north this morning across the entire area. By the time the storm ends Thursday morning, an additional 8 to 12 inches of snow is expected northwest of an Austin, Minnesota to Necedah, Wisconsin line. Sleet and freezing rain may mix in with the snow at times, with the best potential for hazardous icing conditions being across northeast Iowa and southwest Wisconsin. Ice amounts from a tenth to four tenths of an inch are expected along and south of the Highway 18 corridor through tonight. This ice brings with it the risk of tree and power line damage amplified by winds gusting to 30 to 40 mph. This will be a HIGHLY impactful winter storm with travel severely impacted at times. ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, occasionally mixed with sleet and freezing rain. Additional snow accumulations of 10 to 12 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Minnesota and central, north central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
